text: Nouria Mérah-Benida (born October 19, 1970 in Algiers) is an Algerian middle distance runner. At the 1999 All-Africa Games in Johannesburg Mérah-Benida won silver medals in both 800 metres and 1500 metres. At the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney she won the gold medal. In 2000 she also won an 800 m silver medal and a 1500 m gold medal at the African Championships. ==References== Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Olympic gold medalists for Algeria Category:Middle-distance runners Category:Sportspeople from Algiers
title: Nouria Mérah-Benida
